fields.description:
h3. Summary
The 'Sprint' Field in the 'Create Issue' Screen is cleared when changing projects in Agile planning mode. This is only present when the Agile board has more than 1 project since you can only change a project from the 'Create Issue' screen if there are more than one in the board filter.

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to your Agile board's planning mode and click 'Create Issue' under a specific sprint (make sure there are at least 2 projects in the board's filter)
# You will notice the 'Sprint' field in the 'Create Issue' screen is pre-populated with the sprint that you clicked 'Create Issue' in.
# Now change the project to something else from the Project field
# Notice the 'Sprint' field is cleared
# If the sprint field is empty, the issue will get sent to the Backlog as it is not tied to a sprint.


h3. Expected Results
The sprint field does not get cleared and the issue gets created in that sprint instead of the backlog.

h3. Actual Results
The issue gets created and is sent to the backlog. The end user has to find the issue from the backlog, which defeats the purpose of the 'Create Issue' option within a Sprint.

h3.Workaround
Once the project is changed, manually assign a value to the Sprint field in the 'Create Issue' screen
fields.summary: 'Sprint' Field in 'Create Issue' Screen is Cleared When Changing Project in Agile Planning Mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cannot edit version name on Agile's Plan/Backlog mode. This only affects JIRA Agile 6.6.80 in JIRA 6.3.8.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# In JIRA 6.3.8, with JIRA Agile 6.6.80
# Go to any board > *Plan* mode
# Refer to *Version* section
# Edit version's name (for example *Version 2* is changed to *Version 2 test*) > press enter
# You will see the name has been changed
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Result
The version name shown is *Version 2 test*

h3. Actual Result
The version name shown is *Version 2*

h3. Additional Information
# Only happen in JIRA 6.3.8 with JIRA Agile 6.6.80
# It is not reproducible if you use JIRA Agile 6.6.80 with other version of JIRA
# It is not reproducible if you use JIRA 6.3.8 with other version of JIRA Agile

h3. Resolution
Upgrade JIRA Agile to a higher version (the latest one is 6.7.4)
fields.summary: Cannot Edit Version name on Agile Plan Mode. Only affected JIRA 6.3.8 with Agile 6.6.80

fields.description:
We are the Developers for the plugin [ SAML SingleSignOn for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.resolution.atlasplugins.samlsso.Jira]

Customers reported an issue that they are redirected to the login form instead of the SSO login when opening URLs like https://<jira>/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&view=planning.nodetail . Links like https://<jira>/browse/DEMO-1 are working as expected.

During our tests it came out that modifying the login URL in seraph-config.xml has no effect for the link to the RapidBoard above. This can be reproduced by configuring a custom URL in seaph-config.xml, e. g. like this:
{quote}<init-param>
            <param-name>login.url</param-name>
                <param-value>/plugins/servlet/samlsso</param-value>
        </init-param>
        <init-param>
            <param-name>link.login.url</param-name>
                <param-value>/plugins/servlet/samlsso?redirectTo=${originalurl}</param-value>
        </init-param>{quote}
fields.summary: JIRA agile does not redirect to custom login URL

fields.description:
In Version report, the story points range shown on the graph always exceeds the story point that customer has committed in the stories.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Commit certain number of story points in the stories, lets say 30 story points
# The graph shows the range of 0 - 35 story points
# Now commit more story points, lets say add 6 story points (becomes 36 story points)
# The graph will show the range of 0 - 40 story points

h3. Expected Result
The graph will show the range of story points from 0 to the exact number of story points that user has commited (in this case 36), Thus, once user completes 36 story points, the percentage will show 100%

h3. Actual Result
The graph increase the range of story points (becomes 40 story points). This way, the percentage of user's progress can never reach 100%, as it will always set a higher range of story points, more than what user has committed in the stories.
fields.summary: Version Report does not do correct measurement for Users' Progress

fields.description:
My manager was unable to create an Epic from the Plan form in an Agile board. Using the create Epic link, the window successfully popped up, however it defaulted to "custom fields" rather than "all". We had a required field that was not visible, and he was unable to see the field, therefore could not create the ticket. Yes, he could have clicked All (If he had known that was how JIRA worked). I verified that this is specific to clicking "Create Epic" from the plan page, and not the Create Issue page. 

Reproduction steps:
1) access any agile board that uses epics
2) click "Epic" on the left side
3) scroll over "Epics", and click the link that appears "Create epic"
4) click "Configure Fields" and notice "Custom" is selected, not "All"

fields.description:
When you have one Story in one project linked to an Epic in another project and this Story is moved to the Epic's project and the Story issue type is also moved to Epic, its link to the original Epic is not cleared during the move wizard and the link can not be removed from the edit screen as well. The following message appears in the Epic Link field: {quote}An epic cannot have another epic linked to it.{quote}

h4.Steps to reproduce:
# Create an Epic in one project
# Create a Story in another project
# Link this Story to that Epic
# Move this Story to that Epic's project changing its type to Epic too

h4.Workaround:
Edit the Story's (now Epic) issue type back to Story, remove the Epic Link, then edit its type back to Epic.
fields.summary: Story moved to Epic and to another project doesn't unlink its original Epic

fields.description:
When a sprint is open, we can select a start date. This date can be in the future and after the issue is actually opened. 

When completing and issue, JIRA automatically records the 'Complete Date' as the current date. We are able to complete the sprint before the 'Start Date', having and issue started after it was completed, which doesn't make sense. 

Also, the 'Start Date' and 'Complete Date' are shown in some reports (not the 'End Date'), as the sprint duration. For example, the 'Release burndown' report, that show sprints with a misleading date information.

The 'Complete Date' is not to be mistaken with the 'End Date', which is automatically set based on the sprint duration and it always after the 'Start Date'.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a sprint in a board
# Start the sprint with 'Start Date' some time in the future
# Complete the sprint

*Expected Behavior*
* Start Date before Complete Date is enforced, for example, prompting the user for a new 'Start Date'

*Actual Outcome*
* The 'Complete Date' is set before the 'Start Date'
* This is visible in some reports and in the database
fields.summary: Sprint Start Date can be later than Complete Date

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing a project within JIRA, the 'Versions' tab on the left hand menu does not show up. When viewing issues within the backlog of the project, there is no 'version tag' within the issue description.


h3. *Environment*

This appears to be happening in environments running JIRA v6.5-OD-05-041


h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Log into Cloud instance
# Select a project that has versions configured
# Attempt to click on versions within the left hand menu
## The 'versions' menu item is missing
# Attempt to view the version listing in the backlog issue description
## The 'version tag' is not visible


h3. *Expected Results*

'Versions' should be viewable / clickable in the left hand manu
The 'version tag' should be viewable on the issue description when looking at issues in the backlog


h3. Actual Results

Neither of the above mentioned are viewable

 
h3. *Notes*

This appears to have started over the weekend when customers were updated to JIRA v6.5-OD-05-041


h3. *Workaround*

If the customer has no board configured they will not see the versions tab
If a customer views the Agile board associated with the project, they should see the 'versions' tab on the left hand side along with 'epics'
fields.summary: Versions unable to be viewed within projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When we query the boards involving a given project context for a particular user (for instance, when we are displaying the browse projects agile board view displayed by the new project sidebar). We will issue N + 1 queries where N = the number of boards in  the system. 

For a sufficiently high value of N (thousands), this will cause a notable slowdown in the operations performing this call. 

h3. Environment

* A large number of Agile boards, i.e. thousands

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a large number (thousands) of JIRA Agile boards
# Load a project page
# Notice the number of SQL queries performed by JIRA Agile

h3. Expected Results

JIRA Agile should only issue one query to load all agile boards from the database, which should not have a significant performance impact on the load time of the browse projects page.

h3. Actual Results

JIRA Agile performs N + 1 queries to load all agile boards from the database, where N = number of agile boards stored in the database, with a significant impact in the rendering speed of the browse projects page.

h3. Workaround

Disable the new project navigation as per [Configuring Project Navigation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Project+Navigation] to disable it globally, or [Project Navigation Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Project+navigation+options] on a per-user basis.
fields.summary: Loading all boards related to a project for a given user results in an excessive number of SQL queries

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Charts display a higher amount of Elapsed time than it should.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have issues that were on a previously deleted status with the status recreated
# Access the Control Chart

h3. Expected Results
Chart should display the amount of time spent on the issues

h3. Actual Results
Amount of time is higher than it's supposed to be
 
h3.Solution / Workaround
# Update the status IDs on the changeitem table to match the new status ids with the following query.
{code:SQL}
update changeitem
set oldvalue = S.id
from issuestatus S
where changeitem.oldstring = S.pname
and changeitem.field = 'status'
and oldvalue != S.id;
{code}
{code:SQL}
update changeitem
set newvalue = S.id
from issuestatus S
where changeitem.newstring = S.pname
and changeitem.field = 'status'
and newvalue != S.id;
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a large number of issues are created without a rank value (say from a project import), the subsequent full reindex will take a significant amount of time.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Project import a large amount of issues into a JIRA Agile enabled project.
# Perform a full reindex.

This can also be reproduced by any of the following:

* Adding a new rank field to an existing instance and reindexing.
* Very high issue creation load.

h3. Expected Results

The reindex operations completes as per the reasonable expected speed.

h3. Actual Results

The full reindex takes a significant amount of time.

h3. Verification

# [Generate a Thread Dump|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Generating+a+Thread+Dump] during reindexing operations.
# Verify if there are a number of threads waiting to lock {{java.lang.Object}}. This can be done by using [TDA|http://java.net/projects/tda], or if using Linux the below command will help:
{noformat}
grep -A1 "com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation.rankInitially" thread* |grep "waiting to lock" |awk '{print $1}' | sort |uniq -c
  46 thread_dump_01.txt-
  47 thread_dump_02.txt-
  18 thread_dump_03.txt-
  46 thread_dump_04.txt-
  46 thread_dump_05.txt-
  47 thread_dump_06.txt-
  47 thread_dump_07.txt-
  46 thread_dump_08.txt-
  46 thread_dump_09.txt-
  46 thread_dump_10.txt-
{noformat}

In the above results there are a large number of threads waiting for that lock - due to the way the code is currently written it means every single indexing thread awaits a slow operation to complete.

 In the attached thread dumps:

* Customer has increased the max reindex threads to 50 in order to attempt to increase the indexing speed.
* This has caused 46 threads to block waiting for {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation.rankInitially}}.
* As a result, indexing operations take a significant amount of time.

h3. Notes

It appears this is due to rank values being created for the issues that do not have them, as {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation.rankInitially}} causes all indexing threads to block waiting for it to complete.

On an instance with 1500 issues the indexing time on the first run was over 60 seconds, on subsequent runs it was around 30.

(!) It is *not* advised to increase the maximum indexing threads, as this can cause significant performance problems such as what we're seeing in this issue, and also result in more memory being used which can lead to OutOfMemoryErrors. This will leave the indexing process in an unexpected state and require another full reindex to guarantee consistency.

h3. Workaround

Wait for the indexing operations to complete, slowly. This can be sped up by increasing the available resources on the server, reducing the load and also verifying an appropriate read / write speed is present on the Lucene directory. It can be tested as per our [Test the Disk Speed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Testing+Disk+Access+Speed]. Also note we *do not* support NFS mounts for Lucene as per JIRA [Supported Platforms|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms].
fields.summary: JIRA re-indexing is very slow when issues do not have a rank value

2) in a standup meeting, 1 person controlling the screen assigns issues to members of the team.
We have a problem with user case 2 in that issues are assigned to the person dragging them on the board. I understand the reason behind this, because it supports use case 1 and this is true Agile. However, I believe there are many Agile teams in the world working according to use case 2. So I am proposing to give the user the option as to which use case should be active, perhaps we need a Standup button next to the Work button, so Work supports use case 1 and Standup use case 2.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an Agile board includes a custom field that makes use of multi-select or Date/Time picker, and is then used in an Agile Dashboard Gadget, the field is displayed as HTML. When viewing the same board via Agile, the field appears as expected.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.5* (replicated on a Cloud instance)
* JIRA Agile - 6.7.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# *JIRA > System > Admin > Issues > Custom Fields*, *Create Custom Field*
# Select a *Field Type > Select List (multiple choices)*
# Add a title, and multiple options. Create.
# Assign to a screen. I chose the *Default Screen* on a test instance to make it easier.
# Create a test issue in a project that uses the screen you selected above.
# Go to *Agile > Manage Boards > Create Board*. Create a Kanban Board from the existing project. You may need to move your issue over to a column where you can see it.
# While on the board, click *Board > Configure > Card Layout*. Add your field, and go back to the board.
# Verify the custom field displays its results as expected.
# Nagivate to your Dashboard, and click *Add Gadget*. Add the *Agile Wallboard Gadget*, and select your new board.
# You will discover the custom field from the dashboard displays as HTML instead.

h3. Expected Results
The custom field should display as it does on the Agile board itself:

!Screen Shot 2015-05-19 at 3.30.14 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Instead, the field uses HTML to display:

!Screen Shot 2015-05-19 at 3.32.08 PM.png|thumbnail!
* In case of Date/Time picker it will be displayed as '<span title=' 

h3. Notes
It's possible for other custom field types the same issue could occur.

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Using multi-select custom field on Agile Gadget in JIRA Dashboard displays as HTML

In JIRA Agile 6.7 there is a new feature "LexoRank Management".

h3. Actual Results

h3. Notes
This feature replaces many of the manual rest calls covered in the Agile KB guides:
For Example:  [How To Fix Duplicate Rank Values For a Rank Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/How+To+Fix+Duplicate+Rank+Values+For+a+Rank+Field]

fields.description:
h4. +Current behaviour+
*When a new Scrum board is created for a project*, the fields Epic Link, Epic Name, and Sprint will be added to the screen/s used by the project.

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Create a new project *TEST*
# Create a Scrum board for the new project *TEST*
# Sprint and Epic Link fields will be added to the Screen associated to the project *TEST*
# Remove Sprint and Epic Link field from the said Screen
# Create a new Scrum board for the project *TEST*
# Sprint and Epic Link fields will be added back to the Screen associated to the project *TEST*

{panel}
* Epic Name is a required field 
* Users may end up linking issues to incorrect Epics/Sprints{panel}

h4. +Expected behaviour+
These fields should only be added during an UpgradeTask. (GHS-10767)

h4. +Suggestion+
* JIRA Agile should be able to detect whether the Agile fields are already available in one of the screen tabs before attempting to add them to the default Field Tab.
* Allow user to disable these fields to be automatically added by JIRA Agile to selective/all screens.

h4. +Workaround+
There is no known workaround to disable creation of Scrum board by certain groups.

h4. +Additional Information+
These tests are conducted in JIRA 6.3.15 and JIRA 6.4.2 using JIRA Agile 6.7.0

Perhaps the board type should be in the collapsible nav instead of the board name. Or maybe both should display. It seems like there is probably room for both.
fields.summary: Show the board name instead of the board type when the left-nav is collapsed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create two projects named A and B
# Create user named Bob
# In permissions for project A, give Bob permission to schedule issues, create and move issues. Do not give Bob this permission in project B.
# Log in as user Bob
# Create an issue in project A and drag it into a sprint that has not been started on the SCRUM board.
# Open the new issue you created and go to More >> Move. Move the issue to project B.
# Go back to the sprint for project A. Notice that the issue that was moved is still in the sprint. Bob will not have permission to remove it from the sprint and that will require someone with permissions to schedule issues in project B to remove the value of the Sprint field in that issue to remove it from the sprint in project A.

The desired behavior here is for there to be some special handling of sprints when moving issues. When an issue is moved to a project not covered by a SCRUM board's filter query (or some other way of identifying what is relevant to a sprint or not), it should also be removed from the sprint.
fields.summary: Moving an issue to another project does not remove issue from sprints

* This does not occur in Chrome 42

The expected behavior is that the JQL text remains so that it can be modified and saved.
fields.summary: Swimlane JQL field clears when editing JQL in Chrome

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, in the reports fro JIRA Agile, there are some aspects that are not covered, for example : 

* Members of the sprint team
* The issues assigned to the members
* The capacity of those team members

These information can be useful when planning the next sprint, as it would show whether or not the members of the team are overburdened and can finish their tasks on time

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if there could be a report that can cover all the above, as well as integrate the information already shown in the Burndown Chart/Sprint Report. In total, the report should show all of these items :

* Members of the sprint team
* Issues assigned to those members
* Capacity of the team members
* The total estimate of the assigned issues
* The remaining estimate of the assigned issues

This report would be incredibly comprehensive and useful for planning and reporting
fields.summary: As an admin, I want the reports of JIRA Agile to be more comprehensive

fields.description:
Just so you know, I tried to open this with Bitbucket (issue #11316) by following the links from the Jira Plugin "Quick Subtasks for Jira" issues web page (https://bitbucket.org/hascode/jira-quick-subtasks/issues?status=new&status=open), but Gary Sackett closed it the same day, and said to open it with Atlassian instead, which I did (JSP-230852). Then, I received an email from Shafinaz Elahi of Atlassian Support saying that I had once again opened it in the wrong place and gave me a link to a different place to open this, the link brought me here.  I hope this is the right place for this this time: 

This is for "Quick
Subtasks for Jira" plugin. 

We have 6 types of Sub tasks in our jira instance. In the Quick Subtasks plugin, it is documented that you can set the issuetype for a task by appending "/ issuetype:"Bugfix Subtask". But, when you go to add multiple subtasks, the dialog box has an issuetype drop-down
and can only be set to one value. If the issuetype is set by appending it to the text, the drop-down value always overrides it.

This causes the user to have to separately add their subtasks based on the issuetype instead of being able to add all of them in one go regardless of issuetype. Is this the intended functionality and the documentation is wrong, or is this a bug? It would be very beneficial if specifying the issuetype would override the drop-down value.

Thanks!

Mary =)
fields.summary: "Quick Subtasks for Jira" plugin enhancement request (or bug depending on how you look at it)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At the moment, we can only map Statuses to Columns in Rapid Boards. However it would be great if we can map custom fields to columns as well

The use case scenario would be the following
# A project is managed by departments based on it's status
#* eg. All statuses managed by Support but the *In Progress* status would be managed by Developers
# The Dev will work on the issue (multiple stages in this step) but it's status will maintain at *In Progress* until they release the issue (transition to next status)

By allowing custom fields to be mapped by columns, the issue will stay at In Progress throughout the time Dev is working, but they have their own Kanban board to manage the issues in columns. This way, support can easily track the status of the issue
fields.summary: Ability to map custom field to board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After filling in a Text Field when creating an issue in an Agile Board, an error appears. This only happens when the Text Field is using the Wiki Renderer as the renderer of the field, and only when creating an issue via the Agile Board view.

h3. Environment
Tested in :
* JIRA 6.3.15
* JIRA Agile 6.6.70

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Text Field custom field, and configure it to use the Wiki Renderer as the renderer
# Head over to an Agile Board
# Try creating an issue while viewing the board
# Fill in the Text Field, and then click on the area outside of the Text Field

h3. Expected Results

Nothing happens, and the issue can be created normally

h3. Actual Results
When clicking on the area outside of the Text Field (once the field is filled), the following error appears :

!TEXT.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
* Despite the error, the issue is still created 
* This does not occur when creating an issue from outside of the Agile board
* This does not seem to occur in the latest version of JIRA and JIRA Agile (JIRA 6.4.3 with JIRA Agile 6.7.0) even when raising an issue from the Agile board

h3.Solution / Workaround
A workaround for the time being would be to avoid filling the text field when creating the issue
fields.summary: Filling in a Text Field when creating an issue in Agile Board causes an error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the Agile Issue View, the Development Panel would show development information related to that issue that comes from various Atlassian tools (like Fisheye, Stash, Crucible, etc). However, information that comes directly from Subversion is not reflected in the detail view at all. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
It would be great if the information from Subversion can be shown in the Issue View of Agile as well.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to see Subversion related commits in the Agile Issue View

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
# When logged in as administrator, the user is able to create an issue, from the active sprint view, using the Create button. After creating the issue, there will be a pop out which says "Your issue XXX-XX has been created but is not currently visible. *Add to Sprint X*"
!active.png|thumbnail!
# The user is then able to click on *Add to Sprint X* and add the issue directly to the active sprint. 
# However, this is not possible if the user is logged in as a jira-user. He is given the edit & schedule project permissions to add issues to sprint but there is no *Add to Sprint X* option when creating issues on the Active  Sprint. He will only see "Your issue XXX-XX has been created but is not currently visible." Please refer to the screenshot below:
!active2.png|thumbnail!
# This jira-user will have to go back to the backlog and drag the issue from the backlog to the Sprint

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* JIRA Agile 6.7
* JIRA 6.4.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login as a jira-user
# Start a sprint
# Go to Active Sprints
# Click on Create button from the top navigation menu & Create issue.

h3. Expected Results
!active.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
!active2.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Solution / Workaround
# Go back to backlog
# Manually drag & drop the issue from the backlog to the on-going Sprint.
fields.summary: Add to Sprint option not available for jira-users when creating Issue at Active Sprints view
